programme.title: Mégastructures romaines en Gaule
programme.desc:
In the heart of ancient Paris
With its 2,185 monuments, Paris is a world tourism capital. The City of Light also shelters ruins that bear witness to the Gallo-Roman period: a few metres from Place Monge, the Arena of Lutetia is amongst the oldest remains from these ancient times, along with the Cluny thermal baths.
Directed by: Fabrice Buysschaert (France, 2021)

programme.title: Ô la belle vie
programme.desc: Meyrueis, a visionary village In the Jonte Gorges and at the foot of Mont Aigoual, Meyrueis is where the Causses meet the Cévennes. A wild unspoilt valley where villages are rare. Meyrueis itself is home to only 800 inhabitants for a surface area equivalent to that of Paris. Presented by: Sophie Jovillard.

programme.title: Silence, ça pousse !
programme.sub-title: La nature qui change des vies
programme.desc: When nature changes lives An encounter with Thérèse Homassel and her passion for cactus. A new generation working to protect the environment. A bucolic visit to a high-perched garden in the Perche. Valérie and Julien call on Stéphane's skills to distract the eye from the immense wall bordering their garden and create low-maintenance borders. Presented by: Stéphane Marie, Carole Tolila.

programme.title: Pistes vertes
programme.sub-title: Éboueur de rivière/Maraîcher bio/Café éco responsable/Marais des communaux
programme.desc: On his inflatable kayak, Pierre Dubourg collects rubbish floating on the Orne, in Caen. Visit of the school garden in Tollevast, in Cotentin, with an organic fruit and vegetable grower. At La Roche d'Oëtre, Morgane and her companion manage an eco-responsible restaurant. Walk in the valley of the Andelle. Presenter: Laurent Quembre.

programme.title: Version Française
programme.desc: We head to the Army Museum for a strictly "defensive" visit. Furniture, rugs, objects: Alexia Leleu brings her family history to life. Balenciaga breaks all the rules, freeing fashion from its inhibitions. A journey through time with Les Vertugadins, a design studio creating period costumes. Presented by: Katherina Marx.

programme.title: La main à la pâte
programme.desc: Lamb from southern Manitoba Guy and Leah met just a few kilometres from Manitoba's American border. They got married and had lots of little lambs... As well as two boys. In their company, Luc learns more about lamb. Presenter: Luc Jean.

programme.title: L'art et la matière
programme.desc: Pas de description

programme.title: #VF
programme.desc: Pas de description

programme.title: Les 100 lieux qu'il faut voir
programme.desc:
The Isère, from Vienne to high mountain pastures
An exploration of the Isère, from the Massif des Écrins to the southern Dauphiné, where our journey begins in the mediaeval town of Grésivaudan and ends on the vertiginous footbridge high over the Monteynard Lake. High above the famous Route Napoléon, Notre-Dame de La Salette stands at over 1,500 metres.
Directed by: Philippe Vergeot (season 7, France, 2020)

programme.title: Vachement Normand !
programme.desc: Pas de description

programme.title: Ricardo
programme.desc:
Chicken soup and macaroni
Ricardo presents two recipes that are quick and easy to prepare: Tex-Mex style beef macaroni, and chicken soup with konjac noodles.
Presented by: Ricardo Larrivée.

programme.title: Littoral
programme.desc: Pas de description

programme.title: #Versionfrançaise
programme.desc: Programme summary: - Behind the scenes at the Assemblée Nationale - Encounter with Sophie Mainier-Jullerot, gallery owner - A theatrical trip through Paris - Encounter with Lucie de Syracuse, visual artist Presented by: Katherina Marx.

An exploration of the Isère, from the Massif des Écrins to the southern Dauphiné, where our journey begins in the mediaeval town of Grésivaudan and ends on the vertiginous footbridge high over the Monteynard Lake. High above the famous Route Napoléon, Notre-Dame de La Salette stands at over 1,500 metres.

programme.title: Version Française
programme.desc: Pas de description

programme.title: 5 chefs dans ma cuisine
programme.sub-title: Choux de Bruxelles en salade et en soupe
programme.desc: Brussels sprouts as a salad and a soup Émilie Rizzetto cooks Brussels sprouts two different ways: in a soup with leeks and vegan bacon, and in a crunchy salad with hazelnuts. Presented by: Marina Orsini. Directed by: Nicole Dussault, David Gauthier, Stéphane Rocheleau, Léo Boulanger (Canada, 2020)

programme.title: Le grand move
programme.desc: Isabelle and Jaime, Gaspé Peninsula Isabelle and Jaime lived in Montreal with their children. One day, returning from a stay on the Gaspé Peninsula, Jaime suggested they settle there permanently. Directed by: Mariloup Wolfe (Canada, 2020)

programme.title: L'épicerie
programme.desc:
Spicing up the festive season!
Cinnamon, cloves, nutmeg and ginger add a characteristic touch to certain festive recipes. Discover the history of these exotic spices... Also on the programme: a buying guide for wine glasses; all about fonio, a new grain from Africa; and a compilation of twenty years of Christmas programmes from the archives!
Presented by: Johane Despins, Denis Gagné.

programme.title: La peinture française autour du monde
programme.desc: Pas de description

programme.title: Pays et marchés du monde
programme.desc: Région de Mazovie (Pologne) Découverte du marché traditionnel de Minsk Mazowiecki. Présentation : Xavier Petit.

programme.title: Les 100 lieux qu'il faut voir
programme.desc:
The Val-de-Loire, from the royal city of Amboise to Anjou
The Val-de-Loire offers an infinite diversity of landscapes and sumptuous monuments. Amidst its lush forests lie some of France's most sublime châteaux. Crossed by the River Loire, this legendary region is home to Clos Lucé, Leonardo da Vinci's final residence, the Château de Chambord and Fontevraud Abbey.
Directed by: Laure Leibovitz (season 7, France, 2020)

programme.title: Louis et la faune urbaine
programme.desc:
Mount Albert, Ontario
At a client's house, Louis has his work cut out extracting young raccoons from behind her bedroom walls. In Kitchener, Louis handles a nest of chicks.
Presenter: Louis Larose.

programme.title: Curieux Bégin
programme.desc: Nordic food Three guests born in Scandinavia come together to cook dishes from their respective regions: Sweden, Norway and Denmark. Mahée Paiement joins the gang to relive her travel memories! Presented by: Christian Bégin.

programme.title: Histoire(s) de jardins
programme.desc: Pas de description

programme.title: #Versionfrançaise
programme.desc: Programme summary: - Behind the scenes at the Pic du Midi de Bigorre - Encounter with the globetrotting artist Nicolas Lefebvre - Paris, real or illusion? - Focus on the designer Laura Cambon and her creative glasswork Presented by: Katherina Marx.

programme.title: Les 100 lieux qu'il faut voir
programme.desc:
The Haute-Loire, from Puy-en-Velay to the meandering Allier Gorge
A journey through the unspoilt region of the Auvergne volcanoes, where the beauty of the landscape is only equalled by the generosity of the locals. From Puy-en-Velay to Mont Mézenc, Chaise-Dieu to the villages of Blesles and Chilhac, an unmissable adventure for all who love good food and untamed nature.
Directed by: Florent Quet (season 7, France, 2020)

programme.title: Une brique dans le ventre
programme.sub-title: École de village restaurée près de Houffalize
programme.desc: Renovated village school near Houffalize A remarkable result for the renovation of this village school dating from 1870. Jeanne and Amaury used the most environmentally-friendly materials possible. Weekend in Brussels: the Jam Hotel offers a contemplative immersion "made in Japan". Legal affairs with a look at Izimi, the virtual safe. Presented by: Cédric Wautier, Virginie Jacobs.

programme.title: Épicerie fine
programme.desc:
The Pays de Fayence
In the Var, Hugo and Anne-Noëlle open the doors to a farm where they also cultivate well-being. At the Claux Farm, Daniel and Laure offer an open invitation to sample their dairy produce. All about mimosas in Tanneron and the hilltop villages of the Pays de Fayence.
Presented by: Guy Martin Directed by: Émilie Darnaud (France, 2022)

programme.title: La tête à l'endroit
programme.desc: Exploring Jura's regional identity Champagnole is the perfect starting point to visit one of France's best fir plantations: Joux Forest. Guillaume discovers this mysterious would, to learn more about the Jura's regional identity! Presenter: Guillaume Pierre.

programme.title: #Versionfrançaise
programme.sub-title: Citadelle de Blaye/Marc Hertrich et Nicolas Adnet/ Sandrine Pagny
programme.desc: Behind the scenes at the Blaye Citadel on the Gironde estuary. Welcome to the world of the interior designers Marc Hertrich and Nicolas Adnet, of the MHNA Studio. The go-to addresses in Paris for everything Chinese. Bewitching colours and shapes: with Sandrine Pagny ceramics become works of fantasy. Presented by: Katherina Marx.
